intro: Hoffmannia carlsoniae, commonly known as the dwarf hoffmannia, is a flowering plant native to the United States, specifically found in Arizona. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Hoffmannia carlsoniae is a low-growing shrub with compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
